availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jackson South (Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Jane Strong South in Breathitt County, Kentucky, on May 28, 1854. Father of Mary M. South, Levica South, Jemima South, and Eliza South. Farmer in Breathitt County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Breathitt County in 1861. Farmer in Breathitt County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 379.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994029, Breathitt County Marriages, p. 36.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #21196.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Breathitt County, KY, December 1863, p. 324.
